did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Publications, correspondence, research materials, diaries, scrapbooks, and organizational records.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Professional papers of landscape architect and urban planner Byron R. Hanke including publications, correspondence, talks, research materials, diaries, scrapbooks, awards and honors relating to his career in the Federal Housing Administration and as a private sector consultant.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Byron R. Hanke, landscape architect and urban planner, was a consultant and author on residential developments, land planning, automatic-membership property owner's associations and countryside conservation communities. From 1946-1972 he was the national director of land planning of the Federal Housing Administration.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Professional papers of landscape architect and urban planner Byron R. Hanke including publications, correspondence, talks, research materials, diaries, scrapbooks, awards and honors relating to his career in the Federal Housing Administration and as a private sector consultant.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Byron R. Hanke Papers, #6724. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.
